name: Mitochondrial Neurogastrointestinal Encephalomyopathy (MNGIE)
chief_complaint: I've been having severe stomach pain, muscle weakness, and I can't seem to gain weight no matter how much I eat.
physical_findings: cachexia (severe weight loss and muscle wasting)
treatment: nutritional support with parenteral nutrition if needed
prognosis: Poor without treatment, with progressive deterioration leading to death typically in early adulthood. Early diagnosis and stem cell transplantation may improve outcomes.
description: MNGIE is an ultra-rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the TYMP gene, leading to thymidine phosphorylase deficiency. This results in accumulation of thymidine and deoxyuridine, causing mitochondrial DNA instability and dysfunction. The condition affects multiple systems, particularly the gastrointestinal tract and nervous system.
